metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11533 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 processes a crafted file in convert, it can lead to a heap-based buffer over-read in the WriteUILImage() function in coders/uil.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0099-CVE-2017-11533-heap-buffer-overflow-in-uil-coder.patch in unstable 0085-CVE-2017-11533-heap-buffer-overflow-in-uil-coder.patch in stretch 0249-CVE-2017-11533-Fix-buffer-over-read-in-convert-WriteUILImage.patch in wheezy 0271-CVE-2017-11533.patch in jessie

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
